definition: to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: One table-spoonful to be taken at bed-time.
sentences.chinese: 睡前要喝掉满满一汤匙。

sentences.english: I paid for the beer so i call dibs on the last bottle.
sentences.chinese: 因为啤酒是我买的，所以最后一瓶我有权利喝掉。

sentences.english: The average American guzzles nearly a full gallon of soda every week.
sentences.chinese: 美国人平均每周要喝掉1加仑的苏打水。

sentences.english: Studies show that we ALL drink what's put in front of us.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明我们所有人都会喝掉放在我们面前的东西。

sentences.english: He has knocked back two double rums.
sentences.chinese: 他喝掉了两杯双份甜酒。

sentences.english: I wonder what would happen if I drank this potion.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道如果我喝掉这药水会发生什么。

sentences.english: I gave him a glass of water and the drank it thirstily .
sentences.chinese: 我给了他一杯水，他如饥似渴地把它喝掉了。

sentences.english: UK consumers drink an estimated 70million cups of coffee a day.
sentences.chinese: 英国的咖啡消耗者一天要喝掉估计7000万杯咖啡。
狡猾的森姆喝掉莎莉的汤。

sentences.english: We imitated the way you had to lift her head a little so she could drink water, she sucked it up slow out of a green tin cup.
sentences.chinese: 她从一个绿色的锡杯里把水慢慢地吮出来喝掉。

sentences.english: Drink it all in one breath.

sentences.chinese: 狡猾的森姆喝掉莎莉的汤。

sentences.english: Throw a battery into a glass of water, then drink it in half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 扔一节电池到一杯水里，半小时后喝掉。

sentences.english: Why bridge does it pass by, drink Meng old woman soup up , never turn round.
sentences.chinese: 走过奈何桥，喝掉孟婆汤，就再也不回头。

sentences.english: "Are you going to drink those two bottles?" Laigle inquired of Grantaire.
sentences.chinese: “难道你打算喝掉这两瓶酒吗？”赖格尔问格朗泰尔。

sentences.english: He has knocked back two double rums .
sentences.chinese: 他喝掉了两杯双料朗姆酒。

definition: to drain the cup in one gulp (idiom)
